p: For the material substitution effect for building construction, civil engineering, and furniture production, the volume of the life-cycle reduction in carbon emissions from fossil fuel consumption attributable to the substitution of HWPs for non-wooden materials was evaluated. However, it is necessary to determine a figure for the volume of HWP substitution for non-wooden materials. Thus, the BAU scenario was taken as a baseline, and the increase in HWP volumes in the Mod and the Agg scenarios as compared to the BAU scenario were taken to be the volume of substitution for non-wooden materials. For building construction, civil engineering, and furniture production, the annual carbon emissions reduction (tC year −1) attributable to material substitution was evaluated by multiplying, respectively, the increase in the floor area of new wooden building construction (m 2 year −1) and the increase in the consumption of each HWP (m 3 year −1), by the carbon emissions reduction intensity (kgC m −2, kgC m −3). The carbon emissions reduction intensities are shown in Table 2.
